SEARCH

Class App

java.lang.Object
App
public class App extends Object
Scrabble like word game. Generates random tiles for the player and lets them try to spell words. If the word can be spelled, the tiles are removed and the score is shown.
Version:
2025-11-17
Author:
Mohammad Albataineh, Isaiah Johnson

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Program entry point. Creates the tile set, runs the game loop, and interacts with the user until they choose to quit.
      Parameters:
      args - (not used)

    • createTiles

      public static void createTiles(ArrayList<Tile> tiles)
      Initializes the list of all possible tiles with their letters and values.
      Parameters:
      tiles - the list that will be filled with all tiles Aâ€“Z

    • printHand

      public static void printHand(ArrayList<Tile> hand)
      Prints the letters in the player's current hand in a formatted way. Example output: a // j // r // t // o // m // b
      Parameters:
      hand - the current set of tiles in the player's hand

    • getNewTileSet

      public static void getNewTileSet(ArrayList<Tile> hand, int expectedSize)
      Fills the current set of tiles with random tiles until it reaches the expected number of tiles.
      Parameters:
      hand - the current set of tiles in the player's hand
      expectedSize - the desired number of tiles ( 7)

    • canSpell

      public static boolean canSpell(ArrayList<Tile> hand, String word)
      Checks whether the given word can be spelled using the tiles in the hand. If the word can be spelled, the used tiles are removed from the hand and the score for the word is printed.
      Parameters:
      hand - the current set of tiles in the player's hand
      word - the word to be tested
      Returns:
      { true} if the word can be spelled using the tiles; { false} otherwise
